org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.impl

Class AuditEvent

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.beiter.michael.eaudit4j.common.impl.AuditEvent
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Event
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExtendedAuditEvent

    public class AuditEvent
extends Object
implements Event
    This class implements an Event.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AuditEvent

        public AuditEvent()
        Create a new audit event.

        Use this constructor in case you want to create an empty event, and populate it with the setters.

      • AuditEvent

        public AuditEvent(Field... fields)
        Create a new audit event.

        Use this constructor in case you want to create an event that is pre-populated with the provided fields.

        You may still use the setters to add additional fields.

        Note that this constructor creates defensive copies of the data in the provided fields. You need to explicitly clear the fields provided to this constructor if they contain confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Parameters:
        fields - The fields to set

    • Method Detail

      • getRecordFormatVersion

        public final String getRecordFormatVersion()
        Each implementation of the Event interface comes with a JSON serialization.

        This method returns the record format provided in the implementation's JSON serializer. See the library's This method returns the record format provided in the implementation's JSON serializer. See the library's documentation on specifications of supported record format versions.

        Specified by:
        getRecordFormatVersion in interface Event
        Returns:
        The record format version implemented by the Event implementation's JSON serializer

      • setField

        public final String setField(Field field)
        Add a field to the event.

        Note that implementations of this method should create a defensive copy of the provided Field), and stores the copy in the event. You need to explicitly clear the data provided to this method if it contains confidential information that you wish to destroy.

        Specified by:
        setField in interface Event
        Parameters:
        field - The field to add
        Returns:
        The name of the field that was added to the event
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When field is null

      • containsField

        public final boolean containsField(String fieldName)
        Checks if the event contains a field with the specified name.
        Specified by:
        containsField in interface Event
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field name to check for
        Returns:
        true if the field is registered with the event, false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When fieldName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When className is empty

      • unsetField

        Remove a field from the event.
        Specified by:
        unsetField in interface Event
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The name of the field to remove
        Returns:

      • getField

        public final Field getField(String fieldName)

        Specified by:
        getField in interface Event

        fieldName - The name of the field to retrieve.

        The value of the specified field
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When fieldName is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When className is empty

      • getFieldNames

        public final List<String> getFieldNames()
        Retrieve a list of all fields (i.e. a list of field names) currently registered with the event.

        Note that the returned implementation of List may or may not be thread safe. If multiple threads access the returned list concurrently, and at least one of the threads modifies the list structurally, it should be synchronized externally.

        Note that the returned implementation of List may be an unmodifiable List (e.g. wrapped into Collections.unmodifiableList().

        Specified by:
        getFieldNames in interface Event
        Returns:
        A list of field names

      • clear

        public final void clear()
        Clears the content of the field's value.

        This method calls the Field.clear() method of all fields associated with this event, and then removes them from the event. Use this call to wipe potentially confidential information from memory.

        Specified by:
        clear in interface Event

      • toJson

        public final char[] toJson(String encoding)
        Create a JSON serialized representation of the event using the provided String encoding. This JSON representation in particular contains all fields that are registered with the event.

        The event is serialized into a default format, the version of which can be obtained with the Event.getRecordFormatVersion() method.

        When calling this method, make sure to use the same encoding that was used when setting the field values, for instance with the Field.setValue(byte[], Encodings) method.

        Specified by:
        toJson in interface Event
        Parameters:
        encoding - The string encoding to use (e.g. UTF-8)
        Returns:
        A JSON representation of the event.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - When encoding is null
        IllegalArgumentException - When encoding is empty
